content: Thalcave’s people faded as colonists advanced; his father, last of the tribal guides, knew the pampas geography and animal ways, while his mother died giving birth. Boyhood was spent roaming the plains with his father, learning to track, tame horses and steer by the stars.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Thalcave’s people faded as colonists advanced.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "people", "colonists", "advanced"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Thalcave's father was the last of the tribal guides.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "father", "tribal guides"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Thalcave's mother died giving birth.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "mother", "died", "giving birth"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Thalcave spent his boyhood roaming the plains with his father.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "boyhood", "roaming", "plains", "father"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "Thalcave learned to track, tame horses, and steer by the stars.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "learned", "track", "tame horses", "steer", "stars"]}]

content: Suspected again in 1815, he was re-arrested and shipped to the Château d’If, this time for life.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Faria was suspected again in 1815.", "keywords": ["Faria", "suspected", "1815"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Faria was re-arrested and shipped to the Château d’If.", "keywords": ["Faria", "re-arrested", "Château d’If"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Faria was sentenced to life imprisonment.", "keywords": ["Faria", "life imprisonment", "sentenced"]}]

content: Before each fight he studied the crack-patterns of his mother’s shark-tooth necklace by moonlight to divine the outcome.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou studied the crack-patterns of his mother’s shark-tooth necklace.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "shark-tooth necklace", "crack-patterns"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou studied the crack-patterns by moonlight.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "moonlight", "crack-patterns"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou studied the crack-patterns to divine the outcome of fights.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "divine", "outcome", "fights"]}]

content: Villefort’s drift toward the royalists disappointed him; father and son argued politics at every family gathering.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Noirtier is Villefort's father.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Villefort", "father"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Noirtier was disappointed by Villefort's drift toward the royalists.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "disappointed", "royalists"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Noirtier and Villefort argued about politics at every family gathering.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Villefort", "politics", "family gathering"]}]

content: His parents were targeted in a reprisal for supporting the Revolution; his mother was killed, deepening his distrust of authority.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Noirtier's parents were targeted in a reprisal for supporting the Revolution.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "parents", "Revolution", "reprisal"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Noirtier's mother was killed.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "mother", "killed"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Noirtier has a distrust of authority.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "distrust", "authority"]}]

content: The mutiny began when Captain Grant uncovered his forged logbook and threatened to report him; “marooning” was a botched silencing in which Ayrton, thinking fast, locked the captain inside the keel-less lifeboat.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton was involved in a mutiny against Captain Grant.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "mutiny", "Captain Grant"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Captain Grant uncovered a forged logbook belonging to Tom Ayrton.", "keywords": ["Captain Grant", "forged logbook", "Tom Ayrton"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton locked Captain Grant inside a keel-less lifeboat.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "locked", "Captain Grant", "keel-less lifeboat"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "The act of marooning was a botched silencing attempt by Tom Ayrton.", "keywords": ["marooning", "botched silencing", "Tom Ayrton"]}]

content: He once found bribery entries in his father’s old ledgers, reported them, and saw his father’s colleague dismissed; temporary gossip made him wary of the upper nobility.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel found bribery entries in his father’s old ledgers.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "bribery entries", "father's ledgers"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel reported the bribery entries.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "reported", "bribery entries"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel saw his father’s colleague dismissed.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "father's colleague", "dismissed"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel became wary of the upper nobility due to temporary gossip.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "wary", "upper nobility", "gossip"]}]

content: He rescued the indigenous elder Yurook from colonists and gained tribal protection, learning bush tracking while secretly mapping settler outposts.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton rescued the indigenous elder Yurook from colonists.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "Yurook", "rescue", "colonists"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton gained tribal protection after rescuing Yurook.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "tribal protection", "Yurook"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton learned bush tracking while mapping settler outposts.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "bush tracking", "mapping", "settler outposts"]}]

content: At ten, migrating with his clan, a flame-shaped birth-mark on his forehead convinced elders he was the reincarnation of the “sun-devouring warrior.” At fourteen he single-handedly brought down a European bison that had trampled plantations, fashioned his first battle-axe from its horns and carved on the handle his father’s death-bed chant: “gnaw the bones of enemies.”
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou has a flame-shaped birth-mark on his forehead.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "birth-mark"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "At the age of fourteen, Kai-Koumou single-handedly brought down a European bison.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "European bison", "fourteen"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou fashioned his first battle-axe from the horns of the European bison.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "battle-axe", "horns"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou carved his father’s death-bed chant on the handle of his battle-axe.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "father", "death-bed chant"]}]

content: He accidentally slipped a farewell letter to his French sweetheart into an academic report; the romance ended, yet the Academy of Sciences praised the document.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel accidentally slipped a farewell letter to his French sweetheart into an academic report.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "farewell letter", "academic report"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "The romance between Jacques Paganel and his French sweetheart ended.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "romance", "French sweetheart"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "The Academy of Sciences praised the document that Jacques Paganel submitted.", "keywords": ["Academy of Sciences", "praised", "document"]}]

content: In a skirmish at a British outpost friendly fire killed several of his comrades; he took bones from their bodies as tokens, swore to shield the survivors and from that moment sealed his emotions.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou was involved in a skirmish at a British outpost.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "skirmish", "British outpost"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Friendly fire killed several of Kai-Koumou's comrades.", "keywords": ["friendly fire", "killed", "comrades"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou took bones from the bodies of his comrades as tokens.", "keywords": ["took bones", "tokens", "comrades"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou swore to shield the survivors after the skirmish.", "keywords": ["swore", "shield", "survivors"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou sealed his emotions from the moment he swore to shield the survivors.", "keywords": ["sealed emotions", "swore", "survivors"]}]

content: At eighteen, on the run in Tasmania, he met the escaped convict Ayrton hiding in the bush; the two fugitives pooled their languages and survival skills, raided together for ransom and forged a brotherhood laced with mutual wariness.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou was eighteen years old when he was on the run in Tasmania.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "eighteen", "Tasmania"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou met the escaped convict Ayrton while hiding in the bush.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "Ayrton", "escaped convict", "bush"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou and Ayrton pooled their languages and survival skills.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "Ayrton", "languages", "survival skills"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou and Ayrton raided together for ransom.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "Ayrton", "raided", "ransom"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou and Ayrton forged a brotherhood laced with mutual wariness.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "Ayrton", "brotherhood", "mutual wariness"]}]

content: After graduation a secret society enlisted him as strategist and propagandist in a campaign against corrupt rulers.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Faria was enlisted by a secret society.", "keywords": ["Faria", "secret society", "enlisted"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Faria served as a strategist in a campaign.", "keywords": ["Faria", "strategist", "campaign"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Faria worked as a propagandist against corrupt rulers.", "keywords": ["Faria", "propagandist", "corrupt rulers"]}]

content: Under the alias “Citizen Noirtier” he joined the Girondins, drafted parts of the Revolutionary Code and broke with Robespierre over whether courts should keep formal procedures.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Noirtier joined the Girondins.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Girondins"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Noirtier drafted parts of the Revolutionary Code.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Revolutionary Code"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Noirtier broke with Robespierre over whether courts should keep formal procedures.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Robespierre", "formal procedures"]}]

content: Born on New Zealand’s North-island east coast to a Maori war-chief father and a priestess mother skilled in herbs and star-reading, he saw his father ambushed by a British musket squad, the body mutilated, the left ear taken as trophy; his mother tattooed a vengeance curse on his chest with ochre.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou was born on New Zealand’s North-island east coast.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "New Zealand", "birthplace"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou's father was a Maori war-chief.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "father", "Maori war-chief"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou's mother was a priestess skilled in herbs and star-reading.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "mother", "priestess", "herbs", "star-reading"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou witnessed his father being ambushed by a British musket squad.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "father", "ambushed", "British musket squad"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "The body of Kai-Koumou's father was mutilated and his left ear was taken as a trophy.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "father", "mutilated", "left ear", "trophy"]}, {"claim_id": 6, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou's mother tattooed a vengeance curse on his chest with ochre.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "mother", "tattooed", "vengeance curse", "ochre"]}]

content: Through underground circles he met the Count of Monte Cristo and fed the avenger vital information, lending invisible aid to the plot against his enemies.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Noirtier met the Count of Monte Cristo through underground circles.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Count of Monte Cristo", "underground circles"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Noirtier fed the Count of Monte Cristo vital information.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Count of Monte Cristo", "vital information"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Noirtier lent invisible aid to the Count of Monte Cristo's plot against his enemies.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "invisible aid", "plot", "enemies"]}]

content: After the killing, elders held a “Blood-and-Bone” rite; he lifted fragments of his mother’s burnt bones to his lips to “breathe in her spirit,” a ritual he repeated whenever catastrophe loomed, turning him gloomy yet unyielding.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou participated in a 'Blood-and-Bone' rite after a killing.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "Blood-and-Bone", "rite"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou lifted fragments of his mother’s burnt bones to his lips.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "mother", "burnt bones"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou repeated the ritual of breathing in his mother's spirit whenever catastrophe loomed.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "ritual", "catastrophe"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "The ritual turned Kai-Koumou gloomy yet unyielding.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "gloomy", "unyielding"]}]

content: His first double role: hired by a British Geographical Society expedition, he quietly altered the route to shield sacred Indian sites.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Thalcave was hired by a British Geographical Society expedition.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "British Geographical Society", "expedition"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Thalcave altered the route of the expedition.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "altered route", "expedition"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Thalcave altered the route to shield sacred Indian sites.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "sacred Indian sites", "altered route"]}]

content: He declined to take part in charting the maiden voyage of the Britannia; when news of her wreck arrived he filled three diary pages with the sentence “I could have prevented it.”
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel declined to take part in charting the maiden voyage of the Britannia.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "Britannia", "maiden voyage"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel filled three diary pages with the sentence 'I could have prevented it.'", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "diary", "I could have prevented it"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel expressed regret after the news of the Britannia's wreck arrived.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "regret", "Britannia", "wreck"]}]

content: His deference to Lady Glenarvan echoed the tangled feelings he had once held for his mother; by becoming the expedition’s “living map” he tried to atone for failing to protect her.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel has a complicated relationship with Lady Glenarvan.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "Lady Glenarvan", "relationship"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel once had tangled feelings for his mother.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "mother", "feelings"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel attempts to atone for failing to protect his mother by becoming the expedition's 'living map'.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "atonement", "living map"]}]

content: During the Revolution he acted as a militant republican, attended major assemblies and helped organise trials of royalists.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Noirtier acted as a militant republican during the Revolution.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "militant republican", "Revolution"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Noirtier attended major assemblies during the Revolution.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "major assemblies", "Revolution"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Noirtier helped organise trials of royalists.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "organise trials", "royalists"]}]

content: **Father-son Rift**: Discovering that his elder son Gérard (Villefort) sought to wed into the old aristocracy, Noirtier publicly burned the Saint-Méran betrothal contract (1804), forcing Villefort to flee to Paris overnight.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Noirtier publicly burned the Saint-Méran betrothal contract in 1804.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Saint-Méran", "betrothal contract", "1804"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Noirtier is the father of Gérard Villefort.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Gérard Villefort", "father-son"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Gérard Villefort fled to Paris overnight after the burning of the betrothal contract.", "keywords": ["Gérard Villefort", "fled", "Paris", "betrothal contract"]}]

content: At twelve, Jacques Paganel fell in love with geography after reading Captain Cook’s nautical journal; with a homemade telescope he studied the stars and papered his bedroom walls with maps he drew himself, earning his father’s scolding for neglecting “serious” pursuits.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel fell in love with geography at twelve.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "geography", "twelve"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "He read Captain Cook’s nautical journal.", "keywords": ["Captain Cook", "nautical journal", "reading"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "He studied the stars with a homemade telescope.", "keywords": ["studied", "stars", "homemade telescope"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "He papered his bedroom walls with maps he drew himself.", "keywords": ["bedroom walls", "maps", "drawn"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "His father scolded him for neglecting serious pursuits.", "keywords": ["father", "scolding", "serious pursuits"]}]

content: One night he saw first mate Ayrton secretly meet slave-traders; while shadowing them he was slashed across the left forearm with a dagger.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel saw first mate Ayrton secretly meet slave-traders.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "Ayrton", "slave-traders"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel was slashed across the left forearm with a dagger.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "slashed", "left forearm", "dagger"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel was shadowing the slave-traders when he was attacked.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "shadowing", "slave-traders", "attacked"]}]

content: British officers marvelled that he handled canoe, coast and jungle with equal ease, shuttling supplies and so preparing his later berth on the Dartmouth.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Thalcave handled canoe, coast and jungle with equal ease.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "canoe", "coast", "jungle"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Thalcave shuttled supplies.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "shuttled", "supplies"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Thalcave prepared for his later berth on the Dartmouth.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "berth", "Dartmouth"]}]

content: Napoleon’s triumph at Waterloo ended his hopes; in 1815 he withdrew from active plotting and turned to family affairs.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Noirtier is a character in 'The Count of Monte Cristo'.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "The Count of Monte Cristo"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Noirtier is related to the protagonist, Edmond Dantès.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Edmond Dantès", "relationship"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Noirtier is depicted as an elderly man who is paralyzed.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "elderly", "paralyzed"]}]

content: Lord Glenarvan met him briefly at a London Royal Geographical Society dinner, was struck by his encyclopaedic knowledge of mountains and seas and hired him at once as guide for the South-American interior.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Thalcave was hired by Lord Glenarvan as a guide for the South-American interior.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "Lord Glenarvan", "guide", "South-American interior"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Lord Glenarvan met Thalcave at a London Royal Geographical Society dinner.", "keywords": ["Lord Glenarvan", "Thalcave", "London", "Royal Geographical Society", "dinner"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Thalcave has encyclopaedic knowledge of mountains and seas.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "encyclopaedic knowledge", "mountains", "seas"]}]

content: **Turning Point**: Arguing for procedural justice at Louis XVI’s trial (1793) he was driven from the inner circle, an experience that later anchored his insistence on legal formalism.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Noirtier argued for procedural justice at Louis XVI’s trial in 1793.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "procedural justice", "Louis XVI", "trial", "1793"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Noirtier was driven from the inner circle as a result of his arguments during the trial.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "driven from inner circle", "trial"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Noirtier's experience at the trial anchored his insistence on legal formalism.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "legal formalism", "trial", "insistence"]}]

content: He found ship’s papers that mentioned an illicit Australian land deal by a British peer and planned to trade the information for a pardon.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton found ship's papers.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "ship's papers"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "The ship's papers mentioned an illicit Australian land deal.", "keywords": ["illicit", "Australian land deal"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton planned to trade the information for a pardon.", "keywords": ["trade", "information", "pardon"]}]

content: Born into a Parisian legal family, he absorbed his father’s staunch republicanism and his mother’s gentler sensibility, learning to balance reason with feeling.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Noirtier was born into a Parisian legal family.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Parisian", "legal family"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Noirtier absorbed his father’s staunch republicanism.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "father", "republicanism"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Noirtier learned to balance reason with feeling.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "balance", "reason", "feeling"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Noirtier's mother had a gentler sensibility.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "mother", "gentler sensibility"]}]

content: In Rome he and Noirtier de Villefort studied Napoleon’s secret letters together, then quarrelled over whether to publish their contents.
label: consistent

content: In Lisbon he backed constitutionalist Prince Pedro, was branded a Jacobin plotter out to poison King John VI and fled conservatives’ pursuit.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Faria backed constitutionalist Prince Pedro in Lisbon.", "keywords": ["Faria", "Prince Pedro", "Lisbon"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Faria was branded a Jacobin plotter.", "keywords": ["Faria", "Jacobin", "plotter"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Faria fled conservatives’ pursuit.", "keywords": ["Faria", "fled", "conservatives"]}]

content: Suspected of colluding with the enemy, he panicked, slipped away in a lifeboat under darkness and fled to the Southern Hemisphere.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton is suspected of colluding with the enemy.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "colluding", "enemy"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton panicked and slipped away in a lifeboat.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "panicked", "lifeboat"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton fled to the Southern Hemisphere.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "fled", "Southern Hemisphere"]}]

content: He married a gentle apolitical woman, hoping domestic peace would replace political strife, and pinned on his son Villefort the hope that the boy would carry his ideals forward.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Noirtier married a gentle apolitical woman.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "marriage", "gentle", "apolitical"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Noirtier hoped for domestic peace to replace political strife.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "domestic peace", "political strife"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Noirtier pinned his hopes on his son Villefort to carry his ideals forward.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Villefort", "hopes", "ideals"]}]

content: His invisible-ink formula came from temple-mural restoration in India, first used to rescue local epics the colonists had defaced.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Faria developed an invisible-ink formula.", "keywords": ["Faria", "invisible-ink", "formula"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Faria's invisible-ink formula originated from temple-mural restoration in India.", "keywords": ["Faria", "temple-mural", "restoration", "India"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Faria first used his invisible-ink formula to rescue local epics that colonists had defaced.", "keywords": ["Faria", "invisible-ink", "rescue", "local epics", "colonists", "defaced"]}]

content: The night before the mate was hanged he pressed a dagger engraved with his family crest into the boy’s hand.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton was pressed a dagger engraved with his family crest.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "dagger", "family crest"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "The mate was hanged the night before he pressed the dagger into the boy's hand.", "keywords": ["mate", "hanged", "dagger"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "The boy received the dagger from the mate.", "keywords": ["boy", "dagger", "mate"]}]

content: At seventeen he was poisoned by an uncle during a succession struggle; manuka-bark saved him and left his nature darker. To obtain powder against the colonists he led thirty warriors against the French merchantman Amethyst, seized flint-lock muskets and picked up basic French, then discovered the captain selling Maori slaves and sacrificed every prisoner to the volcano-god.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou was poisoned by an uncle during a succession struggle at the age of seventeen.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "poisoned", "uncle", "succession struggle", "seventeen"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Manuka-bark saved Kai-Koumou and left his nature darker.", "keywords": ["manuka-bark", "saved", "darker nature"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou led thirty warriors against the French merchantman Amethyst.", "keywords": ["led", "thirty warriors", "French merchantman", "Amethyst"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou seized flint-lock muskets during the attack on the Amethyst.", "keywords": ["seized", "flint-lock muskets", "Amethyst"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou picked up basic French.", "keywords": ["picked up", "basic French"]}, {"claim_id": 6, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou discovered the captain of the Amethyst selling Maori slaves.", "keywords": ["discovered", "captain", "selling", "Maori slaves"]}, {"claim_id": 7, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou sacrificed every prisoner to the volcano-god.", "keywords": ["sacrificed", "every prisoner", "volcano-god"]}]

content: He saved an old shepherd bitten by a viper; in gratitude the man gave him a secret map of pampas water-holes and taught him that a guide’s duty is to keep life moving.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Thalcave saved an old shepherd who was bitten by a viper.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "shepherd", "viper"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "The old shepherd gave Thalcave a secret map of pampas water-holes.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "shepherd", "map", "pampas", "water-holes"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "The old shepherd taught Thalcave that a guide’s duty is to keep life moving.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "shepherd", "guide", "duty"]}]

content: During an Algerian geological survey he shielded a box of specimens in a sand-storm, was struck on the head and afterwards often mixed up dates and directions.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel shielded a box of specimens during an Algerian geological survey.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "geological survey", "Algeria", "specimens"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel was struck on the head during a sand-storm.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "struck", "head", "sand-storm"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "After being struck on the head, Jacques Paganel often mixed up dates and directions.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "mixed up", "dates", "directions"]}]

content: After discharge he adopted the alias Ben Joyce and shipped on the Liverpool–Lisbon trader, forming a mentor-friend bond with Captain Dewey and second mate Eddie.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton adopted the alias Ben Joyce.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "Ben Joyce", "alias"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Ben Joyce shipped on the Liverpool–Lisbon trader.", "keywords": ["Ben Joyce", "Liverpool–Lisbon trader", "shipped"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Ben Joyce formed a mentor-friend bond with Captain Dewey.", "keywords": ["Ben Joyce", "mentor-friend bond", "Captain Dewey"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Ben Joyce formed a mentor-friend bond with second mate Eddie.", "keywords": ["Ben Joyce", "mentor-friend bond", "second mate Eddie"]}]

content: Because he spoke both French and English he was posted to a Mediterranean merchant fleet where he learned basic seamanship and celestial navigation.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel spoke both French and English.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "French", "English"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel was posted to a Mediterranean merchant fleet.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "Mediterranean", "merchant fleet"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel learned basic seamanship and celestial navigation.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "seamanship", "celestial navigation"]}]

content: Born in Parma to a theological family—his father studied ancient manuscripts, his mother wrote poetry in several tongues.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Faria was born in Parma.", "keywords": ["Faria", "born", "Parma"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Faria's father studied ancient manuscripts.", "keywords": ["Faria", "father", "ancient manuscripts"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Faria's mother wrote poetry in several tongues.", "keywords": ["Faria", "mother", "poetry", "several tongues"]}]

content: Enlightenment ideals of liberty, equality and fraternity sustained him, turning even the dungeon into a classroom for hope.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Faria was imprisoned in a dungeon.", "keywords": ["Faria", "imprisoned", "dungeon"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Faria believed in Enlightenment ideals of liberty, equality, and fraternity.", "keywords": ["Faria", "Enlightenment", "liberty", "equality", "fraternity"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Faria turned the dungeon into a classroom for hope.", "keywords": ["Faria", "dungeon", "classroom", "hope"]}]

content: During the north-island war he let troops burn an empty village, lured them into a swamp and battered them with captured European cannon; the victory won him the name “Bone-Eater,” but shrapnel crippled his left leg and he thereafter leaned on a peach-wood staff carved with sea-monster totems.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou let troops burn an empty village during the north-island war.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "north-island war", "burn village"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou lured troops into a swamp.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "lured", "swamp"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou battered troops with captured European cannon.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "battered", "European cannon"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "The victory in battle won Kai-Koumou the name 'Bone-Eater.'", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "victory", "Bone-Eater"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "Shrapnel crippled Kai-Koumou's left leg.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "shrapnel", "crippled leg"]}, {"claim_id": 6, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou leans on a peach-wood staff carved with sea-monster totems.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "peach-wood staff", "sea-monster totems"]}]

content: Born in Liverpool’s slums to an alcoholic sailor father and a mother who died of tuberculosis while he was young, he watched his father be transported for smuggling and then endured an orphanage where nuns pilfered relief supplies, teaching him to despise authority.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton was born in Liverpool's slums.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "Liverpool", "slums"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton's father was an alcoholic sailor.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "father", "alcoholic", "sailor"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton's mother died of tuberculosis when he was young.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "mother", "tuberculosis", "young"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton watched his father be transported for smuggling.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "father", "transported", "smuggling"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton endured an orphanage where nuns pilfered relief supplies.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "orphanage", "nuns", "pilfered", "relief supplies"]}, {"claim_id": 6, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton learned to despise authority.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "despise", "authority"]}]

content: While escaping he hid lifetime research manuscripts in a Madeira monastery cellar—the eventual clue to Monte Cristo’s treasure.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Faria hid lifetime research manuscripts in a Madeira monastery cellar.", "keywords": ["Faria", "manuscripts", "Madeira", "monastery", "cellar"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "The manuscripts serve as a clue to Monte Cristo's treasure.", "keywords": ["manuscripts", "clue", "Monte Cristo", "treasure"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Faria is a character in 'The Count of Monte Cristo'.", "keywords": ["Faria", "character", "The Count of Monte Cristo"]}]

content: In a Marseille waterfront bar he met young Captain Grant; a fierce argument over Magellan Strait tides almost came to blows, but ended in mutual respect and an exchange of pocket-watches.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel met young Captain Grant in a Marseille waterfront bar.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "Captain Grant", "Marseille", "waterfront bar"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel and Captain Grant had a fierce argument over Magellan Strait tides.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "Captain Grant", "argument", "Magellan Strait", "tides"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "The argument between Jacques Paganel and Captain Grant almost came to blows.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "Captain Grant", "argument", "almost came to blows"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel and Captain Grant ended their argument in mutual respect.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "Captain Grant", "mutual respect", "argument"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel and Captain Grant exchanged pocket-watches.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "Captain Grant", "exchange", "pocket-watches"]}]

content: He carried a European pocket-watch taken from the French mate, its inner lid holding a lock of Julia’s hair, which explained both his grasp of mechanical time and his disgust for Christian objects.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou carried a European pocket-watch.", "keywords": ["Kai-Koumou", "European pocket-watch"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "The pocket-watch was taken from the French mate.", "keywords": ["pocket-watch", "French mate"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "The inner lid of the pocket-watch held a lock of Julia’s hair.", "keywords": ["inner lid", "lock of Julia's hair"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou had a grasp of mechanical time.", "keywords": ["grasp", "mechanical time"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "Kai-Koumou had a disgust for Christian objects.", "keywords": ["disgust", "Christian objects"]}]

content: His father died early; his mother remarried a French officer, so the boy grew up fluent in English and French, later adding Spanish from an English tutor.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel's father died early.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "father", "died early"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel's mother remarried a French officer.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "mother", "remarried", "French officer"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel grew up fluent in English and French.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "fluent", "English", "French"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel later added Spanish from an English tutor.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "added", "Spanish", "English tutor"]}]

content: After a failed attempt to save a drowning comrade he was injured; the naval commander’s praise when he recovered left him with a strong sense of duty toward rescue.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel was injured after a failed attempt to save a drowning comrade.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "injured", "drowning comrade"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "The naval commander praised Jacques Paganel when he recovered.", "keywords": ["naval commander", "praise", "recovered"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel developed a strong sense of duty toward rescue.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "sense of duty", "rescue"]}]

content: While recording thirty-two dialects along the Murray River he was expelled by British colonists; after his notes were burned he vowed to “measure every hidden truth with my own feet.”
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel recorded thirty-two dialects along the Murray River.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "dialects", "Murray River"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel was expelled by British colonists.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "expelled", "British colonists"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel's notes were burned.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "notes", "burned"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel vowed to measure every hidden truth with his own feet.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "vowed", "measure", "hidden truth"]}]

content: At a Vienna-congress salon he briefly watched young prosecutor Villefort tamper with evidence against an Italian revolutionary.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Faria watched young prosecutor Villefort tamper with evidence.", "keywords": ["Faria", "Villefort", "tamper", "evidence"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Faria was present at a Vienna-congress salon.", "keywords": ["Faria", "Vienna-congress", "salon"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Villefort was a prosecutor.", "keywords": ["Villefort", "prosecutor"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "The evidence Villefort tampered with was against an Italian revolutionary.", "keywords": ["Villefort", "tamper", "evidence", "Italian revolutionary"]}]

content: Loss turned him taciturn, acting more than speaking; he felt deep pity for sufferers and stayed calmly watchful toward oppressors.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Thalcave experienced loss that made him taciturn.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "loss", "taciturn"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Thalcave acted more than he spoke.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "action", "speech"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Thalcave felt deep pity for sufferers.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "pity", "sufferers"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Thalcave stayed calmly watchful toward oppressors.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "watchful", "oppressors"]}]

content: Ritual disguise: the Bible-quoting habit he had picked up as a mission pupil became a mask for his emotions.

claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton has a habit of quoting the Bible.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "Bible", "habit"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton picked up the Bible-quoting habit as a mission pupil.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "mission pupil", "Bible-quoting"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "The Bible-quoting habit became a mask for Tom Ayrton's emotions.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "mask", "emotions"]}]

content: Finding missionaries wrapping opium in Bible pages, he ordered every book burned except the sheepskin map showing ancestral migration routes.

content: He invented a “salt-blood” ink that revealed under heat, used it to help a Corsican patriot escape, and was transferred to the more secure Château d’If for the trouble.
label: consistent

content: His sister was burned as a witch for spurning a nobleman; the injustice fed a lifelong hatred of institutional rot.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Faria's sister was burned as a witch.", "keywords": ["Faria", "sister", "burned", "witch"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Faria's sister was punished for spurning a nobleman.", "keywords": ["Faria", "sister", "spurning", "nobleman"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Faria harbored a lifelong hatred of institutional rot.", "keywords": ["Faria", "hatred", "institutional rot"]}]

content: Sitting in on lectures uninvited, he was thrown out after shouting “The secret is on the 37th southern parallel!” while the professor explained Earth’s equatorial bulge.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel sat in on lectures uninvited.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "lectures", "uninvited"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel was thrown out of a lecture.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "thrown out", "lecture"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel shouted about the 37th southern parallel during a lecture.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "shouted", "37th southern parallel"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "The professor was explaining Earth's equatorial bulge when Jacques Paganel interrupted.", "keywords": ["professor", "Earth's equatorial bulge", "interrupted"]}]

content: In India he watched British troops crush a rising; to spare the rebel leader further torture he gave the man a merciful death, shaping his ethic of “killing when kindness demands it.”
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Faria watched British troops crush a rising in India.", "keywords": ["Faria", "British troops", "India", "rising"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Faria gave a merciful death to a rebel leader to spare him further torture.", "keywords": ["Faria", "merciful death", "rebel leader", "torture"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Faria's ethic is shaped by the principle of 'killing when kindness demands it.'", "keywords": ["Faria", "ethic", "killing", "kindness"]}]

content: Skilled in shipboard medicine, he secretly stitched soldiers’ wounds yet distrusted shipmates, keeping a mental log and cultivating a “save-yourself-first” instinct.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton is skilled in shipboard medicine.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "shipboard medicine"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "He secretly stitched soldiers’ wounds.", "keywords": ["stitched", "soldiers' wounds"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton distrusted his shipmates.", "keywords": ["distrusted", "shipmates"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "He kept a mental log.", "keywords": ["mental log", "Tom Ayrton"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "He cultivated a 'save-yourself-first' instinct.", "keywords": ["save-yourself-first", "instinct"]}]

content: When he saw that Valentine had inherited his trembling hands he began training her to communicate by eye movement (1819); after his own paralysis the method evolved into a blink-code.
label: contradict

label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Thalcave briefly loved Chilean doctor Mariana.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "Mariana", "love"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Mariana wanted Thalcave to settle down.", "keywords": ["Mariana", "settle down", "Thalcave"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Mariana died nursing cholera-stricken Indians.", "keywords": ["Mariana", "cholera", "Indians"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Thalcave burned Mariana's belongings.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "burned", "belongings"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "Thalcave kept the brass compass given to him by Mariana.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "brass compass", "Mariana"]}]

content: With the rescue squad he learned enough nautical English to converse with Captain Horace and the sailors.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Thalcave learned enough nautical English to converse with Captain Horace.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "nautical English", "Captain Horace"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Thalcave was part of a rescue squad.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "rescue squad"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Thalcave interacted with sailors.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "sailors"]}]

content: In Lisbon he unwittingly helped a black-marketeer dodge duty, was introduced to Duncan’s smuggling ring and, using his sea-craft, slipped past patrols several times; guilt nibbled at him yet profit lured him deeper.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton unwittingly helped a black-marketeer dodge duty in Lisbon.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "black-marketeer", "Lisbon"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton was introduced to Duncan’s smuggling ring.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "Duncan", "smuggling ring"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Tom Ayrton used his sea-craft to slip past patrols several times.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "sea-craft", "patrols"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Guilt nibbled at Tom Ayrton yet profit lured him deeper into smuggling.", "keywords": ["Tom Ayrton", "guilt", "profit", "smuggling"]}]

content: After his mother died she entrusted him with the care of his toddler half-brother; the child was later taken to Europe by the French stepfather and never heard from again, leaving Paganel with a lifelong dread of “separation by life and death.”
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Jacques Paganel's mother died.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "mother", "died"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Paganel was entrusted with the care of his toddler half-brother.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "care", "toddler half-brother"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "The toddler half-brother was taken to Europe by the French stepfather.", "keywords": ["toddler half-brother", "Europe", "French stepfather"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Paganel never heard from his half-brother again.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "half-brother", "never heard from"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "Paganel has a lifelong dread of separation by life and death.", "keywords": ["Jacques Paganel", "lifelong dread", "separation"]}]

content: To obtain royalist intelligence from the Vendée he married Éloïse, daughter of a ruined local noble (1800); when he learned she secretly backed the Chouans he arranged her “accidental” drowning (1802).
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Noirtier married Éloïse, the daughter of a ruined local noble.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Éloïse", "marriage", "noble"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Noirtier obtained royalist intelligence from the Vendée.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "royalist intelligence", "Vendée"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Noirtier arranged the accidental drowning of Éloïse.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "accidental drowning", "Éloïse"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Éloïse secretly backed the Chouans.", "keywords": ["Éloïse", "Chouans", "backing"]}]

content: Growing up in Paris he devoured Voltaire and Rousseau, burning with enthusiasm for liberty and equality.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Noirtier grew up in Paris.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Paris"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Noirtier devoured the works of Voltaire.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Voltaire"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Noirtier devoured the works of Rousseau.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "Rousseau"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Noirtier was enthusiastic about liberty and equality.", "keywords": ["Noirtier", "liberty", "equality"]}]

content: Long political warfare severed him from his family; the once-noble house declined and could offer no help.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Faria was severed from his family due to long political warfare.", "keywords": ["Faria", "political warfare", "family"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Faria's once-noble house declined.", "keywords": ["Faria", "noble house", "declined"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Faria's family could offer no help.", "keywords": ["Faria", "family", "help"]}]

content: What seemed an epileptic fit was in fact sudden death from years of drinking prison water laced with lead.
label: contradict
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Faria suffered from what seemed to be an epileptic fit.", "keywords": ["Faria", "epileptic fit"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Faria died suddenly.", "keywords": ["Faria", "sudden death"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Faria's death was caused by years of drinking prison water laced with lead.", "keywords": ["Faria", "prison water", "lead"]}]

content: Passing as a half-caste gaucho he worked on a ranch, picked up Spanish and the settlers’ rules, yet guarded his tribe’s herb lore and nature beliefs.
label: consistent
claims: [{"claim_id": 1, "claim_text": "Thalcave passed as a half-caste gaucho.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "half-caste", "gaucho"]}, {"claim_id": 2, "claim_text": "Thalcave worked on a ranch.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "worked", "ranch"]}, {"claim_id": 3, "claim_text": "Thalcave picked up Spanish.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "picked up", "Spanish"]}, {"claim_id": 4, "claim_text": "Thalcave guarded his tribe's herb lore.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "guarded", "herb lore"]}, {"claim_id": 5, "claim_text": "Thalcave guarded his tribe's nature beliefs.", "keywords": ["Thalcave", "guarded", "nature beliefs"]}]
